intro: Perytis annulata, commonly known as the ringed sedge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Perytis annulata is often found in wetland environments and is adapted to moist, nutrient-rich soils.
